data.title: Top 75 Disaster Movies
data.meta_description:
Best Disaster Films of All Time Best Disaster Films in any form (drama, action, adventure, comedy, apocalypse fiction, science fiction, fantasy e.t.c.). Notice: The list includes movies' plot which center around the impact and not the aftermath of disaster

Definition: Disaster Film is a film genre that has an impending or ongoing disaster as its subject and primary plot device. Such disasters may include natural disasters, accidents, military/terrorist attacks or global catastrophes such as a pandemic. A subgenre of action films, these films usually feature some degree of build-up, the disaster itself, and sometimes the aftermath, usually from the point of view of specific individual characters or their families or portraying the survival tactics of different people. These films often feature large casts of actors and multiple plot lines, focusing on the characters' attempts to avert, escape or cope with the disaster and its aftermath. 

Characteristics: impending or ongoing disaster, large cast, multiple plot-lines, suspenseful action, races against time, human race annihilation, global catastrophes, man-made disaster, political context, end-of-world tale, societal threat, deadly epidemic, space threat (asteroid/comet impact, alien invasion, space race colonisation), terrorist attack, biological warfare, nuclear apocalypse, zombie/monsters apocalypse, Biblical apocalypse, accidents (plane crash, train crash), ecological disasters (global warming, pollution), natural phenomena (earthquake, cataclysm, volcanic eruption, hurricanes, tsunami, sea storms, tropical storms, landslides, massive fires). 

Essential / Must-see / Genre-defying Disaster movies:  
* Airport (1970)
* The Poseidon Adventure (1972)
* The Towering Inferno (1974)
* Titanic (1997)
* Deep Impact (1998)


Other Lists: Top 100 Adventure Movies (All Time) (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls063871039) Top 100 Survival Thrillers (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls096690417) Top 75 Survival Horror Movies (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls086792308) Top 75 Snow Movies (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls540803830)
data.text:
Best Disaster Films of All Time

Best Disaster Films in any form (drama, action, adventure, comedy, apocalypse fiction, science fiction, fantasy e.t.c.). Notice: The list includes movies' plot which center around the impact and not the aftermath of disaster

Definition: Disaster Film is a film genre that has an impending or ongoing disaster as its subject and primary plot device. Such disasters may include natural disasters, accidents, military/terrorist attacks or global catastrophes such as a pandemic. A subgenre of action films, these films usually feature some degree of build-up, the disaster itself, and sometimes the aftermath, usually from the point of view of specific individual characters or their families or portraying the survival tactics of different people. These films often feature large casts of actors and multiple plot lines, focusing on the characters' attempts to avert, escape or cope with the disaster and its aftermath.

Characteristics: impending or ongoing disaster, large cast, multiple plot-lines, suspenseful action, races against time, human race annihilation, global catastrophes, man-made disaster, political context, end-of-world tale, societal threat, deadly epidemic, space threat (asteroid/comet impact, alien invasion, space race colonisation), terrorist attack, biological warfare, nuclear apocalypse, zombie/monsters apocalypse, Biblical apocalypse, accidents (plane crash, train crash), ecological disasters (global warming, pollution), natural phenomena (earthquake, cataclysm, volcanic eruption, hurricanes, tsunami, sea storms, tropical storms, landslides, massive fires).
